revised_title: Long-term Effects of Oil Pollution on Marine Populations: Population Fluctuations and Recruitment
tldr: This article discusses the long-term effects of oil pollution on marine populations, focusing on population fluctuations and recruitment. It highlights the importance of understanding natural variations in populations and the need for long-term data to assess the impact of pollutants. The author provides examples of various marine populations, such as Arcto-Norwegian cod, and emphasizes the role of recruitment fluctuations in determining changes in adult fish stocks.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Marine Ecology
